asteroids

Class Angle

  • java.lang.Object
    • asteroids.Angle

  • public class Angle
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper class for angles.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Tom Sydney Kerckhove & Xavier Goas Aguililla
    Invariants:
  • The angle value of this angle is a valid angle.
        canHaveAsAngle(getAngle())
  • The angle value of this angle is between 0 and 2Pi
        ((getAngle() >= 0) && (getAngle() <= 2 * Math.PI))

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Angle()
      Initializes this new angle with a default angle value.
      Angle(double angle)
      Initializes this new angle with a given angle value.

      Checks whether the given object is an angle and it is equal to this angle.

      Gets the angle value of this angle.

      Returns the cosine of this angle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Angle

        public Angle(double angle)
        Initializes this new angle with a given angle value.
        Parameters:
        angle - The given angle.
        Precondition:
        The given angle value is a valid angle.
            canHaveAsAngle(angle)
        Postcondition:
        The angle value of this new Angle is a valid angle value.
            new.canHaveAsAngle(getAngle)
        Effect:
        The angle of this angle is set to the given angle.
            setAngle(angle)

      • Angle

        public Angle()
        Initializes this new angle with a default angle value.
        Postcondition:
        The given angle is a valid angle.
            new.canHaveAsAngle(angle)
        Effect:
        Calls the extended constructor with default values.
            this(0.0)

    • Method Detail

      • getAngle

        @Basic
@Raw
public double getAngle()
        Gets the angle value of this angle.

      • canHaveAsAngle

        @Basic
@Raw
protected boolean canHaveAsAngle(double angle)
        Checks whether this angle can have the given angle as its angle.
        Parameters:
        angle - The angle to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given angle is a number.
            result == (!Double.isNaN(angle))

      • setAngle

        @Basic
@Raw
public void setAngle(double angle)
        Sets the angle value of this angle to the corresponding positive angle value of the given angle value.
        Parameters:
        angle - The new angle for this angle.
        Precondition:
        The given angle value is a valid angle value.
            canHaveAsAngle(angle)
        Postcondition:
        The angle value of this angle is now equal to the given angle value modulo 2Pi.
            (getAngle() >= 0) && (getAngle() <= 2*Math.PI))

      • getSin

        public double getSin()
        Returns the sine of this angle.
        Returns:
        The sine of this angle
            result == Math.sin(getAngle())

      • getCos

        public double getCos()
        Returns the cosine of this angle.
        Returns:
        The cosine of this angle
            result == Math.cos(getAngle())

      • add

        public void add(Angle a)
        Adds a given angle to this angle.
        Parameters:
        a - The given angle.
        Effect:
        Adds the value of the given angle to this angle.
            setAngle(getAngle() + a.getAngle())

      • equals

        @Raw
public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Checks whether the given object is an angle and it is equal to this angle.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The given object.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given object is an angle and it is equal to this angle.
            result == ((o != null) && (Util.fuzzyEquals(((Angle) o).getAngle(),getAngle())))
